name: Old Music And Variety TV Shows Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who starred in the 'Texaco Star Theatre'?
What singer in early TV was called 'Mr. Relaxation' and was also known for his casual dress?
questions.explanation:
Perry Como.

	His theme song was 'Dream Along With Me'.

questions.text: Who was the 'Dean' of the 'Kollege of Musical Knowledge'?
questions.explanation:
Kay Kyser.

	On TV from 1949 to 1954. Tennessee Ernie Ford was the emcee in 1954.

questions.text: (True or False) Both Elvis Presley and Buddy Holly failed their auditions for Arthur Godfrey's 'Talent Scouts'?
questions.explanation:
True.

	We all know they both went on to bigger and better things.

Art Linkletter.

	Pat Paulson among others got his start there.

questions.text: With whom did everybody sing along in the 1960s?
questions.explanation:
Mitch Miller.

	'Sing Along With Mitch' from 1961 to 1966.

questions.text: On what musical variety show was Dick Van Dyke a regular on in 1958?
questions.explanation:
Andy Williams Show.

	The theme song of the show was 'Moon River'.

questions.text: (True or False)Dinah Shore, Martin and Lewis and the Beatles all had their TV debut, in the United States, on the 'Ed Sullivan Show'?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Also Lena Horne and Eddie Fisher among others.

questions.text: What talk show host once sang with the Kay Kyser band?
Who always ended her show by singing 'See the USA in your Chevrolet'?
questions.explanation:
Dinah Shore.

	That was her theme song and she always followed it with a resounding kiss to the audience.
